snippet: Under the deal, production will increase to 35 episodes a year from the current 18, and a spinoff show and another new educational series for children will be created.
abstract: Sesame Workshop, nonprofit group that produces Sesame Street television program, reaches five-year deal with HBO to bring first-run episodes of children's show exclusively to premium cable network starting in fall 2015; group will produce 35 new Sesame Street episodes a year, up from current 18; shows will be available free on PBS, home to Sesame Street for 45 years, after appearing only on HBO for nine months.
lead_paragraph: Under the deal, production will increase to 35 episodes a year from the current 18, and a spinoff show and another new educational series for children will be created.

headline.main: ‘Sesame Street’ to Air First on HBO for Next 5 Seasons
headline.print_headline: Bert and Ernie Take Their Act to HBO in ‘Sesame Street’ Deal
